title: Matrix Modeling - using state transition diagram

content.question:
The diagram shows two states, labeled 1 and 2.

A loop from state 1 pointing back to state 1 is labeled 0.2.

An arrow from state 1 to state 2 is labeled 0.8.

A loop from state 2 pointing back to state 2 is labeled 0.9.

An arrow from state 2 to state 1 is labeled 0.1.

Objects in a system can be in two possible states: state <math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math> and state <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math>. The state transition diagram for this situation is shown. The diagram indicates that <math alttext="20 percent sign"><mn>20</mn><mo>%</mo></math> of objects in state <math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math> remain in state <math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math> between stages and that <math alttext="90 percent sign"><mn>90</mn><mo>%</mo></math> of objects in state <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> remain in state <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> between stages. The constant <math alttext="a subscript i"><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> gives the percent of objects in state <math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math> at stage <math alttext="i"><mi>i</mi></math>. The constant <math alttext="b subscript i"><msub><mi>b</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> gives the percent of objects in state <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> at stage <math alttext="i"><mi>i</mi></math>. Matrix <math alttext="M"><mi>M</mi></math> is a <math alttext="2 by 2"><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>2</mn></math> transition matrix that is used to model objects transitioning between states such that <math alttext="M times a 2 by 1 matrix with row 1 column 1 value a subscript n, row 2 column 1 value b subscript n end matrix equals a 2 by 1 matrix with row 1 column 1 value a subscript n plus 1 end subscript, row 2 column 1 value b subscript n plus 1 end subscript end matrix"><mi>M</mi><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>n</mi></msub></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mi>b</mi><mi>n</mi></msub></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mi>a</mi><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mi>b</mi><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>. Which of the following defines <math alttext="M"><mi>M</mi></math> ?
